result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L. Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentenced to time served.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
Payment plan $50.00 mo commencing December 1, 2016.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard L. Wallace in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. failure to report to jail, 946.425 (1m)(a).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to that amended Ct. 1.  Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court amends Ct. 1 to Misd. failure to report to jail, 946.425 (1m)(a).

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.    
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.

Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 45 days in the Marquette County Jail; consecutive to any other sentence
Credit = 43 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on December 1, 2016
Signed by BNB/10-27-16

for Leave to File Additional Motions
- filed by Atty Frank
- filed by Atty Frank
Return date on November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
**Cash bond has been amended to a signature bond.

Defendant Richard L. Wallace in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Richard L. Wallace in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Frank; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today. Atty Hendee states that the parties agree to amending the cash bond to a signature bond with same conditions.   Atty Frank agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Frank states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Frank enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered
Set for Return

BY THE COURT:  Court amends the cash bond to a $500 Signature bond with conditions.
  Return date scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
DA Cover Letter to Clerk w/Discovery Demand
Discovery Demand

Atty Ryan Frank
SBN: 1070836
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond. BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 cash bond.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds the time limits for the preliminary hearing have been waived freely, voluntarily and intelligently.

Defendant Richard L. Wallace in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 BY THE COURT:  Court quashes warrant on defendant's appearance today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
of Warrant Cancellation by MASO
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on September 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Richard L. Wallace not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that MASO was going to get the defendant from Dane County Jail however, they will not release him due to new charges in Dane County.

BY THE COURT:  Reset  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on July 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
